result.execSummary:
The defendant Brady K. Kaufman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Entry into Locked Coin Box, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.125(1).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Brady K. Kaufman
Current: PO Box 2000, New Lisbon Correctional, New Lisbon, WI 53950 United States  (Effective: 07-13-2015)
Prior: N8880 N. Casper Road, Alma Center, WI 54611
destroyed

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody with Attorney Sebion.  Court recited the charges and possible penalties to the defendant.   Defendant plead no contest to counts 2 and 3.  Count 1 dismissed but read in for sentencing purposes..  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defendant understood.  Defense stipulated to a factual basis.  Court found that the defendant entered his plea, and waived his constitutional rights freely, voluntarily and intelligently.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty as plead to.  State recommended 2 years probation, each count concurrent.  Consecutive to ES in Eau Claire Co. Case no. 13CF828, 14CF787, 14CF143.  Restitution.  Follow all condition of extended supervision ordered in 13CF828.  Obey recommendations of agent based on compas.  No contact with the victims in person, or their properties.  Attorney Sebion agrees.  Joint recommendation.  Defendant did not exercise his right to allocution.  Court ordered sentence withheld, 2 years probation.  Consecutive to extended supervision in Eau Claire Co. Case no. 13CF828, 14CF787, 14CF143.  Restitution & surcharges, payable monthly through probation.  Follow all conditions of extended supervision ordered in 13CF828, 14CF787, 14CF143.  No contact with the victims in person, or their properties, unless approved by his agent.  May have contact by telephone or through the mail.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions. CC.
Restitution worksheet.
July 6
Plea/sentencing hearing at 07-06-2015 01:30 pm
Waive reading of information.  NGP entered by defense.  Court entered NGP.  PTC & STC set.
DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Sebion.  Waiver of preliminary hearing form filed.  Court reviewed form.  Probable cause found.
Preliminary hearing at 05-22-2015 11:00 am

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from Dodge correctional.  Attorney Sebion appeared in court.  No agreement between the parties, set for preliminary hearing.  45 min needed per attorneys.
DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from Dodge Correctional.  Attorney Sebion appeared in court.

Status conference at 05-07-2015 09:45 am.
Pre-trial conference at 04-15-2015 10:00 am.

ADA Inlow appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the Eau Claire County Jail.  Attorney Sebion appeared in court.  Reading of the complaint waived.  Time limit for preliminary hearing waived.  Bond ordered coverted from cash to signature bond.  Same amount and conditions.  PTC & STC set.
Adjourned initial appearance at 03-27-2015 10:30 am
Adjourned initial appearance at 04-17-2015 03:30 pm

DA Fox appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant FTA, currently in the Eau Claire County Jail.  Attorney William Poss appeared for Attorney Sebion.  Attorney Poss requested that the initial appearance be rescheduled to a VTC date.
Mailed defendant's NOH to Eau Claire County Jail and faxed the minutes to the jail after getting fax #.
Adjourned initial appearance at 03-23-2015 09:30 am

Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals:  Donald Forsting, laundromat in Alma Center, or Judd S.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Must report to Jackson County Jail to be booked for these charges.

Defendant appeared by video from Eau Claire County Jail with no counsel present in courtroom.  Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant has received complaint and will contact public defender.  He states he is not sure how much longer he will be in the ECC Jail.  He still has new charges there that he hasn't made appearances for.  DA requests a $1000 cash bond with conditions.  Court grants that request and sets bond.  Adjourned initial appearance set for 3-23-15 at 9:30.
Initial appearance at 03-05-2015 09:15 am
